ccre.ctrl

Class PauseTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.PauseTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BooleanInput, BooleanInputPoll, EventOutput

    public class PauseTimer
extends java.lang.Object
implements BooleanInput, EventOutput
    A PauseTimer has a boolean state for running or not, which is readable but not directly writable. It can be started by an event, and runs until the end of its time period, at which point it turns off. If the event occurs during this time, the timer gets reset to the start of the duration. Reading a PauseTimer returns TRUE if it is running and FALSE if it is not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PauseTimer(long timeout)
      Create a new PauseTimer with the specified timeout in milliseconds.

      • send

        public void send(BooleanOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: BooleanInput
        Subscribe to changes in this boolean input's value. The boolean output will be modified whenever the value of this input changes. If available, the current value of the input will be written at this time.
        Specified by:
        send in interface BooleanInput
        Parameters:
        output - The boolean output to notify when the value changes.

      • unsend

        public void unsend(BooleanOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: BooleanInput
        Unsubscribe from changes in this boolean input's value. This reverses the actions of a previous send call.
        Specified by:
        unsend in interface BooleanInput
        Parameters:
        output - The output to unsubscribe.
        See Also:
